I tried applying the value towards the same service plus additional sessions but was told I couldnâ€™t. Overall, doesnâ€™t make any sense, not pleased with treatment and will not be coming back.</Text>< Pictures>

<resp>{'time': 1550704020602, 'text': "We appreciate your review, but are disappointed that you did not take in to consideration that we honored 2 groupon promos from you in less than a years time, when our voucher clearly states that we only accept 1-per customer every 12 months.  We were even going to accept the 3rd groupon, but when you arrived at our office, you presented us with an expired groupon.  Groupon's policy states we are to honor the price you paid for the groupon and apply it to one of our REGULAR priced services (not another discounted service).   Per this policy, we offered you the $35 towards our REGULAR priced hour massage, but you did not want to do that, you wanted to apply it toward another discounted package of massages.\nFYI:  Groupons are marketing tools for businesses, and if we accepted them non-stop we would go out of business.  We actually lose money on these promos, as Groupon gets the bulk of the discounted rate you pay them.  We are truly sorry we were unable to accommodate your request this time, but I believe we went above and beyond in your case.  Yours in Health!  Dr. Karen"}< /resp><gmap_id>0x80dd2768be9473ab:0xbf94e383c3e439b6</gmap_id></record></dataset><record>

The dental assistant did my x rays  in a timely manner. However, I was not seen by the doctor till 7:50. Once Dr Shakespeare looked at my x-rays  he doubted anything was wrong. I told Dr that I felt a sharp pain in between my teeth. So he proceeded to use a mental strip to attempt to create a opening in between. The problem is that didn't work,  so he used a drill.  He stated it wouldn't cause pain but it did! His excuse for it being painful was that water function on the drill was on. I told Dr to numb my mouth before proceeding to drill in between my teeth. Dr Shakespeare then told me he didn't have time and that he had other patients. He also said that my appointment was only scheduled for 15 minutes. < text>
My son and I currently go to the Sac Health clinic on G st. It is very professional and super clean. (That counts a lot) The doctors are very attentive and show interest in my son and I. They take the time to answer all the questions I have and come back with a solution for any issue I have. What I also like is that they have their own pharmacy in the facility. Which is amazing because dealing with other pharmacys has been such a hassle for me. The only problem I could say I have is the waiting time once your in the patient room. I have been there sometimes for about 2 or 3 hours, but I also keep in mind that it is a teaching facility and the medical students have to run everything past the attending and make their assessments with the attending. Other than that, whenever I need a referall or an ultrasound they handle all of that for me, and just give me a call when all is in order. I've had a good experience with them so far. All in all I love the care they provide.< /text>

< review>
The short time I've been going to the clinic has been a great experience so far. Staff is prompt , and always nice, and helpful. They refered me to a specialist for my gullbladder  surgery, and I didn't care for the first one, so they were happy to try another. Well I just had my surgery on Dec.15, 2018, and now recovering, with my family helping me get well, thank God. It's been a while sence I've been to the clinic, because I had to wait a couple of months to get my surgery after switching surgeons , because the new surgeon was on vacation when I scheduled my appointment with him. Tomorrow morning I will be getting an appointment as soon as poss., because I have ran out of my pain medication, and the surgeon is out of town again, and I really need them. Only because when they were doing my surgery they had some issues and had to cut me all the way open, just got staples out today, and happy about that, and scared because I didn't think it was time to take them out. I will close on that, and just say the Sac clinic is a good clean always, nice staff and doctors, as well as their referrals to other doctors, a blessing all the way around. Thanks Sac clinic for careing.</review>

<UserId.>102168364293710707852</UserId.>< username>
Angela Gonzales< /username>
<Time>1503529661935</Time><Rate>1< /Rate>< text>
I am giving them 1 star, due to the fact that the office is probably the nicest and cleanest doctor's office in all of San Bernardino. I would give zero stars, if I could, for quality of care.  First off, the appointment staff is very rude and unprofessional. Some of the nurses at the office need an attitude adjustment. Some, not all! The doctor that I saw made me feel like I had to choose which one of my disorders did I want treated. My asthma, my pain or my anxiety? Um, how about treating them all?... And if you couldn't, why not refer me to someone/people who could? I was supposed to have a lung function test and was told by the rude check out clerk, I COULD NOT come back until it was done. I called my insurance company two weeks after my appointment and found out NO authorization was ever submitted, and this was a week and a half before my next scheduled appointment! Bottom line, this office and especially Dr. Lucas, need a LOT of help and professional training. Just because you have a nice office, doesn't mean you can skimp out on quality of care.

UPDATE:
I gave them another chance to help me.
First of all, I got my authorization for my lung function test, AFTER I wrote my first review. Coincidence? Probably not. . .
I had a chest x ray done and had to wait a week to get my results. When I requested the results through their portal, as they suggest, my initial request was ignored. I had to send FIVE messages, to two different doctors, before they responded. Well, when I went back to their office I was seen by another doctor at the clinic. After waiting over an hour and a half to be seen, I explained my health issues to the new doc, a med student and the attending doctor. I had a better experience this time, with regards to the new doctor. However, I was told I needed to go back the following week for a follow up. This time, I waited less than 15 mins to be seen. I explained to the doctor that the side effects of the medication she gave me for my asthma, were horrible. I had bone/joint pain, extreme fatigue, it exacerbated my asthma symptoms and caused me severe pain. I was told by another attending doctor, "I don't think you have given the medication enough time to work. You should stay on it". WHAT!? They completely disregarded my issues with the medicine. Oh and they initially tried to convince me that my asthma was in fact my anxiety. WRONG! When they finally did their job, they listened to my lungs, and heard me wheezing. To top it all off, they sent medications to my pharmacy, that I had already told them I could not take, and blamed it on the pharmacy for filling them, and ME for picking them up! I reached out to their "customer service", several times to discuss my complaints, and have yet to receive a response.  I have switched doctors and notified my insurance of their practices. Enough is enough!

P.s. whoever is giving the responses to the reviews, if you could have someone follow up, that would be great, since I can never seem to get anyone to contact me. I used your website, emailed through yelp and have called several times. NO ANSWER!< /text>

< Review>
I was seen back in October of 2016 and was diagnosed with Fibromyalgia. That same day I went to have my lab work done in the same facility and 2 weeks later I went back in for my results. Dr. Perry notified me that all my blood work had been lost EXCEPT for my Vitamin D results. She told me I have a Vitamin D Deficiency and was prescribed me Vitamin D2 50,000 UI One Capsule Once A Week for the Next 8 Weeks. After the first dose, I had an over dose and was in the Emergency Room. I was suppose to be given a supplement along with the Vitamin D2 Prescription. As a result of the over dose I now have Liver Damage and My Vitamin D Deficiency continues to drop even lower. I have tried numerous times to get in contact with Dr. Perry and Dr. Woodruff ( who signed off on Prescription) to discuss this issue. I left a message with the receptionist and did not receive a call back until March of 2017 (5 Months Later).</Review>

< Review>
Came upon this gem of a restaurant while walking around waiting on a table at a place on the main street. It has a huge out door patio, is dog friendly and had no wait. Could this be too good to be true? The food was amazing! Everything we got was delicious, and you could tell was fresh and house made.The service was friendly and fast. I would definitely come back, new favorite spot!</Review>

<Resp>None< /Resp>< name>

< Text>
This place is super cool! They have great food, and a good selection of drinks. I hardly ever drink beer, and when I do (here), it's limited edition beer from the UK. The owner suggested it....so glad he did, and that I tasted it. So worth it, as it was delicious. The live music is good. This place is perfect for going solo to wind down, or to go with friends. DON'T BE DISCOURAGED IF THERE'S AN EVENT GOING I FRONT OF THE CITY-HALL, THESE GUYS ARE STILL OPEN.</Text>

<resp>None</resp><Pictures>None<//Pictures></record></dataset><record>
<text>This small business is definitely cute and local to the Irvine area. Close by UCI, it is not a surprise when you see local college students here. The atmosphere pre-COVID was definitely lively and youthful.

Due to COVID, they take necessary precautions with their masks and making sure that orders are solely to-go. Although outside seating used to be open, they closed it down due to the purple tier.

I remember coming here with my friends before COVID and it definitely brings back nostalgia! I recommend their egg rolls! The service was good but my only one star down was because the pho wasn't as good as I anticipated (MAYBE IT COULD HAVE BEEN JUST THAT DAY HEHE)</text>< resp>
None<//resp>

<rating>5< /rating>< Review>
Love, love this place! Their food and service have been consistently excellent for years. I always get their soup if I stop here. For takeout, my favorite is BBQ beef with rice.< /Review>

< review>
Delicious pho and my absolute favorite Vietnamese iced coffee in all of OC. I'm not sure what they do but it's so smooth and tasty! It is a slightly higher price than you can get it for at other places but for the premium I think it's worth it. Although I would recommend asking for little to no ice.

The waiters are pretty chill but I wouldn't come here expecting high class table service. It feels more like a quick bite to eat place than a true to heart sit down so take that as you will. It doesn't bother me so no harm no foul!< /review>

<GmapID>0x80dcdd946b17bee5:0x423060e8b05c6d2d</GmapID><Rating>5<//Rating><Name>Stromboli15< /Name><Date>1575669628492</Date><Resp>None< /Resp>< Pics>
None<//Pics>
< review>
I came in last weekend because I was in desperate need of pho and spring rolls!! I love this restaurant for it's lovely, clean  appearance, happy cheerful staff, and delightfully light, and fresh tasting food. The spring rolls practically melt in your mouth they're so good! The broth for the pho is super clear and has a fantastic hint of lemon grass. I love that they set you up with a side plate of fresh herbs such as basil, cilantro, mint, sprouts, etc. Everything tastes farm to table fresh!! I also happened to notice the banner that was near the back that states that another one of my favorite places, Ha Long, is also owned by the same family who own Photasia. This made me super happy!! I had no idea of the relationship of the two places, but now that I do, I fully support both for providing such nice, quality Vietnamese food. Thank you!!!< /review>

<Rating>4< /Rating><review>This is our favorite Pho place in Irvine. The service is great, efficient and reasonably friendly. They have great egg rolls and spring rolls and the pho is very flavorful. I've seen them changing out the bones in the broth through the door, so I know it is real beef bone broth. In the summer the vermicelli noodle dishes are cool and refreshing. Grilled pork is a winner on rice or vermicelli. Finally, I personally love their iced tea. I know, small thing to love, but it is always just right strength, not too strong or weak, perfect without sugar, and they keep it refilled.</review><Pics>None<//Pics>< Response>

<Text>First time and last time here.

TLDR: Rude manager and dry food.

Garlic butter rice chicken: tried since I love this dish and was looking for a decent one close by. Both my friend and I ordered one, and both dishes 1) had rice that was very dry and 2) didn't have a smidge of garlic flavor.

When we asked the manager if we got the wrong order, he first ignored us. When he was asked again, he only listed the ingredients of the dish......not answering the question (not lost in translation.) Ok, then see above points about the dish being dry and had no garlic.

Food here is pricier than average for the area.

+1 star for the kind, attentive eldery gentleman who was our waiter.<//Text>< Time>

<user_id>101101915388210700651</user_id><gmap_id>0x80dcdd946b17bee5:0x423060e8b05c6d2d</gmap_id>< name>
d4Daniel USA</name>
<review>Pho Tasia is a clever name that combines Pho and Taste.  It also conjures up images of a magical experience from Disneyâ€™s Fantasia.

Do the food taste magical?  Not quite, but I vouch it is the best Vietnamese food near UCI - unless we drive to Westminster or San Gabriel (search for Golden Deli).  It is much better than nearby Phans55 and Pho So 1, which are average.  Pho Tasia family also run Pho Ba Co and Ha Long, which are good too.

Everything on the menu tasted great - pho (hot noodle soup) or bun (cold vermicelli salad); grilled beef, chicken, pork, pork chop, or shrimp; steamed egg meatloaf, fried egg rolls, cold spring rolls, various dessert drinks, and even the fish sauce.

Prices increased $1-2 in last few years, but they are still reasonable in Irvine standard.  I like the value platter which include a little bit of everything.  Tips: If you order any rice plate, you may add $1 to get a lemonade.

I recommend you also try Thuan Kieu Noodle & Grill.  They specialize in broken rice and grilled meats.  They opened a new locate next to Chipotle on Irvine Blvd at Culver Dr.

Enough food fantasy.  I need to get back to work, so I can pay my food bill.  :-p</review><pics>None</pics></record></dataset><record>

<GmapID>0x80c2c11ec8788e1d:0x193fefba8ac721a7< /GmapID><userid>101562830765297237662< /userid><Pictures>None<//Pictures>< resp>
None< /resp>
< review>
Nice little Park.
Good for Skateboarding.
I found street parking on Palmer.
Not sure if there is more parking elsewhere.

The Skatepark has some fun features.
A quarter pipe section, half of a bowl, a rail, some stairs sets. Some very tall ledges. The Quarter pipes/ half of a bowl section is maybe 4 feet tall? Gets to maybe 5 feet? Smooth and Well made.
Not sure who made it.

Worth checking out if You are in the neighborhood.

There are bathrooms here.
I don't think there are lights.
Come check it out!< /review>
</record></dataset><record>
< user>

< Text>
1. We went to CVS Pharmacy at Beverly Blvd. & La Cienega this pm after visiting Urgent Care dated 11/7/2016...Very Poor Costumer Service. We felt ignored & discriminated
2. My friend went to pick up her BP Medication after visiting Cedars Urgent Care for Hypertension.
3. We went to CVS to pick up her meds & mine at 1545 PM. The manager said that there is no medication for my friend  in the computer & he even phoned urgent care. He promised to call them again. We waited & waited...
4. We phoned urgent care again & gave the manager the Urgent Care Doctor's number.
5. We stayed for another 45 mins,but no calls were made. And because my friend is already c/o of severe headache probably due to high BP. I had to approach the manager to ask for a follow up response
6. The manager said he phoned Urgent Care already, but didn't tell us, while we were waiting for more that 1 hour.
7. We waited for another 10 mins, but to our dismay, we had to call Urgent Care again & they denied getting another call from the CVS manager. So the CVS manager lied to us. Urgent Care claimed that the prescription was faxed already
8. Unfortunately we were at the CVS from 1545 till 1715. For sick people waiting that long.. it's not very comfortable.
ISSUES & CONCERNS:
1.Don't let your costumers wait for long hours. It's not a pleasant feeling, especially when you really feel so sick. Send them home instead  & call them when meds are ready.
2. Don't lie. It's totally unacceptable especially from a CVS manager (Mr. Chad Tamasriro).
3. Don't tell us you're busy. All of us have our own busy moments at work. At least talk to your costumer for an update. Don't tell us "you got your prescription now! What are you complaining about"< /Text>

<Text>This review covers my first initial consult appointment and my actual treatment appointment at this location.
From my first appointment with Natalie Gillen, I was absolutely 100% confident I chose the right person. I had never had any type of aesthetic treatments and I don't really think I needed much. I hoped and prayed I would get someone who was honest and wasn't pushy about needing more than I actually did.
If that is what you are looking for, then Natalie is your girl. She is knowledgeable, experienced, down to earth and so so friendly. She is honest and direct. I ended up getting a few units of Botox with her and I loved how well she explained things to me with  maps of facial muscles, possible reactions and outcomes.. It is important that in this kind of stuff your medical practitioner-keeps it real!
I think it is really important as a consumer to understand that as amazing and incredible as the medical practitioners are at Skin Spirit, they don't have a magic wand. Be realistic with your expectations, be thankful that people like Natalie and the others at Skin Spirit, will tell you what can be done right and what can't. Often people don't like to be told no, and forget that someone is actually looking in their best interest because they are REAL EXPERTS. It shows they take great pride in their work and that integrity is everything to them.
I know this review and referring my friends to Natalie will bite me in the butt someday because her availability will be too full and it'll be harder for me to get in to see her. But she truly is a gem of a person, extremely professional and deserves the kudos for everyone to see.< /Text>< pictures>

< text>
I went to SkinSpirit Palo Alto on Oct 12th, 2019 for my first time visit and had their SignatureFacial treatment with Aurora at 11:30am. After my treatment, my faceÂ has been very red and feels dry and tight for ONE WEEK!!! My neck is very red and itchy!!! Since the fourth day after treatment, skin on my face started to peel!!! I'm writing to share my experience and hope it could help other first time visitors and sensitive skin people to decide whether SkinSpirit is the right place for you.

For sensitive skin people, there is the possibility that the Signature Facial is too aggressive for you. Aurora wiped my face with towels very very very hard for several times and the towel is not soft enough as well. Before my first visit, I have filled out two forms online and selected my skin types and concerns. When I met Aurora, she asked my skin type and concerns again. Aurora has no cause that she didn't get the message I'm sensitive skin.

I went to see a dermatologist on the fourth day after my treatment. After applying the ointment with prescription to restore my skin barrier, my face finally started to turn normal and red color on my skin started to disappear. The ointment is very expensive ($246) even with coverage of health insurance, although you can pay with HSA.

The staff there is friendly. When I called them and asked my treatment details, they would like to help. They asked me to send my red face photos to Aurora, but she never replied my email. She may only be interested in selling you products after treatment lol.

The gmail account is not my full name. Please don't bother me again.< /text>

< review>
There are nice, fluffy and relaxing facials. Then there are medical-grade facials that really get into the skin and take care of business. This week, I was the lucky recipient of a SkinSpirit Signature Facial from Cheryl.

My time in Cheryl's treatment room was spent tucked into her warm and cozy table while she worked to revitalize my tired looking, sun damaged skin. I spent the next seventy-five minutes having my face cleansed, a full session of microdermabrasion all over my face and decollete, a warm, enzyme exfoliant and mask, a round of much needed extractions and an extensive and amazing arm and neck massage. The treatment ended with the application of finishing products, including a moisturizing sunscreen.

Cheryl certainly has the magic touch! My treatment left me in a facial-drunk daze. My skin looked radiant immediately after my service. I couldn't believe how soft my skin felt, even after two days of receiving the facial.

I've experienced plenty of soothing and relaxing facials in five-star spas performed by a variety of talented esthetician, but getting a medical-grade facial from Cheryl at SkinSpirit was "the cherry on top of a sundae" kind of a facial. These treatments are medical-grade facials specifically tailored to your skin and designed to give you results, all while being treated in a calm, soothing and serene environment. These treatments certainly take care of business on the skin, but they're also extremely relaxing during the process.</review>

Thena is AMAZING.  I have followed her like a "groupie."  Receiving facial work inherently comes with apprehension.  For me, the results are paramount; associated pain secondary.  I consider myself extremely fortunate that for well over five years, I have only had Thena perform work on my face (Botox, fillers....).  I find it incredible that in all those years, I have ALWAYS been extremely thrilled with my results. Thena is a Registered Nurse with an impressive background. I have recommended her to many friends and family members.  They all have been equally thrilled with her incredible work. < text>
I had an old wonky sliding glass door replaced by American Vision Windows and appreciated the time they took to ensure that everything would go smoothly.
Christian and Eddie came out to do the measurements, which were done quickly and properly. Christian even helped me figure out how I could lock my old door since my lock had broken and the new door would take awhile to come in.
Once the door arrived Javier, Alan, and Justin came out and installed it efficiently, and it looks great! Javier made sure to go over everything with me about the door before they headed out. They left my home as clean as it was when they arrived.
Overall I would definitely recommend this company.</text>

<Text>We have had the pleasure of working with American Vision Windows for several years.  After we first moved into our home in 1998, we needed to replace the metal frame windows with dual pane vinyl windows.  We choose American Vision Windows as they are a local company with a long history of successful window replacement and quality customer service. Over the years, we have saved thousands of dollars on our energy bills as the windows keep the house cool in the summer and warm in the winter.  Most recently, I wanted to replace our bedroom window with a slider so that we could step out on to patio deck and enjoy the evening sunset. Some people I talked to about this project were not really in favor of the idea as the work to replace the window would be a challenge.  I knew that American Vision Windows would be up for the challenge - And Wow did they deliver!  First of all, we had a quality crew with Gabriel Estrada, Jose Serrano, and Carlos all showing up on time and ready to go on the first day.  All three worked well together as they all kept busy throughout the day.  Each one knew what they were to be doing and made the most of their time and energy.  At the end of the first day, the new slider was installed.  Day two was a half day spent on the final details, the electrical outlets, and the door trim.  I am happy to report, American Vision Windows was up to the challenge and exceed my expectations.  The new bedroom slider is beautiful and adds a new element of design and value to our home.  Thank you once again for making my dream idea a reality. <user_name>Roy M.R.< /user_name><Date>1621181268686< /Date><rate>5</rate>< text>
This is part 2, the Installation, of 5 windows on May 15, 2021 which I bought from American Vision. I discovered when researching the window purchase that the quality of the installation was of equal importance to the selection of the windows themselves. I was told at the time of purchase, by Gonzo Raymond, American Visions sales rep, that the company is staffed with highly professional and interested employees, which included a crack group of installers. The team that installed our windows, Javier (lead), Aaron and Justin R. (apprentice) were just that. They arrived at 8:30 AM, introduced themselves, toured the job site and got right to work. Furniture & flooring were covered in plastic to keep them clean and prevent damage. Each workman had a specific job; they worked both alone and as a team to move the job along at a steady pace. Several times during the 5 hours they were working, I stopped to observe what they were doing and engaged in brief conversations about the process. I was amazed at how rapidly the job progressed. I was exceedingly satisfied with the quality of their workmanship and the speed of the installation.<//text>

< Review>
Richard and his crew (Martin, Danny and Luis M.) came to install 3 sliding doors and 5 windows in my 2-story house.  Most of the installations were on my 2nd story.
At the beginning of the job, I did a walk-through with Richard, and for each window and door, he noted if any unique or special thing had to be done during the installation.  In some cases there were.  He was very knowledgeable and conscious about all the items being well sealed so not to cause any water damage on my 1st floor.
The installation all went smoothly.  Their teamwork was amazing, especially lifting all the heavy sliding to my 2nd story.
I love my new windows and sliders.  They definitely make my 30 year old house look brand new, plus the keep out the heat and minimizes the UV.< /Review>

<user_name>Dale Riedel</user_name>< date>

< rating>

< Text>
Excellent experience with American Vision Windows. From initial consult through professional installation (with Omar B., Omar G., Martin, Richard, Justin, Emidio, and Raul) this company exceeded expectations. I've had windows installed in other homes where the company mismeasured windows resulting in delay. In this case, American Vision measured 13 windows and two sliders perfectly so the manufactured products fit perfectly. They arrived on time and worked diligently throughout the day, taking appropriate breaks and keeping me updated on progress as I teleworked. Arrived on time, big principle for me. They made it look easy. Robert (crew Boss) fulfilled my request to finish my room first. In and out in about 8 hours. No mess and they hauled it all away.

< review>
This is a follow-up to my first review.
American Vision Windows certainly lives up to what they advertise and much more.  I have now had my windows installed (16 windows and 1 sliding glass door).  The windows are amazing.  Solid, great quality and the workmanship on the installation was outstanding.  There was a crew of 7 installing my windows and it was all done in one day.  Flawless to say the least.  Omar B, the crew chief lead the other crew chief's Willy and Martin.  They were assisted by Raul, Ricardo Dez and Leo.  The entire crew was very professional and paid attention to every detail.  The four assistants  worked tirelessly in 90 degree weather ensuring all my furniture was covered and that that there was no installation debris left on my property.  I have never witness a crew to be so professional in their work and most of all, show pride in there work.  Thank you to all who worked at my home, you are to be commended.  As for the windows, I am extremely pleased.  They fit perfectly into the openings and they are solid.  The quality is outstanding.  Most of all, the price was very reasonable.
My experience with American Vision Windows has been outstanding and I highly recommend them for any window retrofit project.
Thank you American Vision Windows and please thank your hard working crew on my behalf.  They are to be commended for their hard work and professionalism.< /review>

< Text>
Our house was built in 1973 and had original windows, patio doors and front door. We initially met with Don A. and he was very knowledgeable about the company. He treated us with kindness and respect and we decided right away to go with American Vision Windows. The windows and patio doors are beyond gorgeous! Omar B. had the rest of the crew, James, Jeremy, Eddy, Carlos and Emidio take on certain windows and patio doors and they did amazing. Chose AVW to give me a quote expecting it would be the most expensive of my options. Surprised they don't hire subcontractors, unlike the home chain stores, and even beat their quote. I also went into this project expecting delays because of Covid, but once the materials came in I scheduled my install. Simple enough.
Richard, Martin, Emidio, Raul, and crew arrived at 8:30a. They explained the process, working with me so I could switch my dogs into different areas of the house, laid out the drop cloths and got to work. < Text>
First, our experience with the sales manager, Don, was great. He didn't try to hard sell and was clear that he might not be the cheapest, but the quality was excellent. We did our research and had to agree. We had questions along the way an Don always got back to us and assured us (we'd had some bad experiences with contractors). The day before our install is was pouring rain so we called. He again assured us saying he would not install if it was going to cost him money in service calls.

The day came and the team showed up on time. I figured there was no way they could install everything in one day on our two-story house including two sliders, but a huge team showed up. Javier, Martin, Nacho, Willy, Omar R., Jose S., Aaron, Ryan and Kane were very respectful of me and our house. Booties and drop cloths everywhere. They worked hard and checked in with me when they had questions about a particular window. Javier even told me one of the windows had a defect, though the part was easily replaced. When we did the final walk through he pointed out the defect, which I could hardly see and might have missed in the walk through, but these guys take pride in their work. They said that they would get the part and schedule a service call within the next couple weeks.

These guys were great, Don was great. They all came through, and now we have beautiful, energy efficient, quiet window. Couldn't be happier.</Text>

< Text>

< Rating>
5</Rating>
< text>
My definition of great service!

Here's my definition of good service.

My 95 year old Aunt had American Vision Windows replace all of the windows in her house way back in October 2005 and she was very happy with them.  Now she's living in a Skilled Nursing Facility and she's asked me to prepare her home for sale.  The ten foot sliding glass door was somewhat difficult for me to open so I called American Vision Windows (I had her original receipt) and asked that they make a 'house call' to see if they could make the window easier to operate.  Scheduling an appointment was painless and today, Chris and Guillermo showed-up right on time.  They patiently explained to me the window was basically operating OK, but over time, regardless of how scrupulously one cleans the track him/herself, debris builds-up underneath the track.  Chris said he'd communicate with Mike, his coordinator to determine what the charge would be to partially disassemble the door, clean underneath the track, then lubricate it.  To my delight (and amazement) Mike authorized Chris and Guillermo to complete the work for no charge.  My Aunt paid $7,250 to replace every single window in her home in 2005 and it's nothing short of inspiring that American Vision Windows would 'tune-up' the sliding glass door, which now, even a 95 year old could easily operate.  Highly recommend these folks.  Good leadership, good people.< /text>

< text>
We had 8 windows and one door replaced by American Vision Windows yesterday. From the initial meeting to the final installation, everything was handled professionally and with great care for accuracy and excellent communications. When they said they would do it, they did it. The entire process makes what happens in most of the construction industry pale by comparison. At the time of our initial meeting, we signed the purchase papers - the experience was just so much more professional than with the other companies who bid on our project. We had carefully explained to us exactly what windows were being bid and why, the proposal was completed in the first visit, and we signed. Two days later the person who does final measurements came at the appointed time to make sure everything measured out precisely. He also made a couple of suggestions to change the way our door was handed, that we really liked and agreed to. In between the time we placed our order and when the installation happened, we received videos from the company explaining the process steps and progress of our order. When the installation was scheduled, the crews showed u[p on time; they put down drop clothes and put up plastic sheeting where necessary, and completed the job with excellence. They explained everything about the windows and door and demonstrated how they work. We are very pleased with the company and with the Anlin windows and door we purchased. I can already tell that the solar heat gain inside our home is negligible, even after one day. Highly recommended!</text>

< time>

<rate>5< /rate>< review>
Our experience with AVW of Simi Valley surpassed our expectations, and we can unreservedly recommend the company and crew for their commitment to excellence and pride in their work.  Our experience at their beautiful showroom was made pleasant by our salesman Gonzo, and his experience and sense of humor made our decision both fun and well informed.  His follow up on the night after the job's completion was a reflection of the total experience from preliminary shopping to completion.

Although we had been forewarned that the job would likely progress to a third day to complete the stucco work on the doors, the entire project was completed in two days from start to finish including a walk through and clean ups after both days' work. Javier was the crew leader, but we  found that Nacho, Mauricio and Rudy were also head men of their own teams whom AVL had assembled to speed up the job.  The work was started on time and completed early both days.  The unified, friendly approach of other workers like Omar, Richard, Daniel, Jonathan and Kane, as well as a few more we never met, showed excellent planning and experience.  The first day's problem of some windows not arriving as per plan was quickly remedied by Javier via a special delivery that morning from Simi, and their installation was completed with no further complication.  Our reservations about the safety during this pandemic were quickly allayed when we saw the entire team in masks which they wore constantly despite the two days' record heat. Fans were also run at the end of both days to ensure our welfare. Three trucks the first day and then five the second with a bigger force was well thought out, and over twenty windows, three French doors and  a big slider went in smoothly and to our satisfaction.  AVW Simi is the best!</review>

< text>
I bought my house over 8 years ago, our windows were installed by the previous owner who included the original contract for American Vision in a big pile of paperwork. Two years ago some of the molding came off the a couple of the windows, I called and was put in touch with Michael, who was very helpful. He asked me to send him photos, after which I promptly lost all the paperwork!

Two years later I found the paperwork again, called them back, and Michael remembered speaking to me and sent a crew out within a couple days. Blair and Sergio arrived on time, and did exceptional work. They did all the requested work, and a bunch of other stuff too - cleaning the windows, adding clips to the screens where they were broken, adding in new caulking/sealant in several areas, and lots of other stuff. All this, without raising the price over what I was quoted. It seems fewer and fewer companies underpromise/overdeliver these days, and I'm happy to say American Vision did exactly that. I'm especially impressed because they did all this knowing I was not the original purchaser/contract holder. I'll use them in the future, and recommend them if you're in the market.< /text>

<user>112339847470505654739< /user>< username>
Michael Guttman<//username>
<Time>1586719846780<//Time><Rating>5< /Rating>< Review>
I recently moved into a townhome that was all single pane windows and near a busy street. Reducing the outside noise was my primary motivation for wanting to get new windows and energy efficiency was also important.

Everyone that was involved in the window install was very friendly and professional. Don, the salesman, explained the process and cost accurately and knew what was needed to get the HOA to approve the new windows. Christian, measured the windows in no time and was very friendly. A few weeks later the installation took place. The crew that installed the windows, Jose, Danny, and Cameron, showed up on time and were extremely courteous the whole time they were working. They gave a rough estimate of how long it would take to complete the install and they did it well within the estimate. I was surprised how fast they did the work.

Iâ€™ve had the windows for a couple of weeks and they look great and cut down the outside noise considerably. Iâ€™m looking forward to saving on my energy bill. I have been working from home and the outside noise is not as noticable, unless a leaf blower is being used right next to my house. Even then, the leaf blower noise is not nearly as annoying.

There is one thing about the windows I was not expecting. The light transmission is less than the prior single pane windows. The good thing about that is the glare from bright daylight is less intense. The downside is there is a little less natural light in the living room and so the inside does not look as bright. Overall, Iâ€™m very happy with my purchase from American Vision.<//Review>

< Text>
The BEST home improvement company we've ever used!  By far!!

The sales rep, Gonzo, was so helpful, punctual, knowledgeable - very personable and funny!  Todd came to the house after Gozno and did the final measuring and ordering (AVW obviously prescribes to the old adage "measure twice, cut once").  He made sure we knew what we were paying for and that we were satisfied with the final order.  Monica D. in the office made sure we were kept up to date and informed (via emails, calls and texts) and was always reachable - so important when you're spending thousands on your home.  Would like to meet her someday. ;) (Inside joke.)

THE DAY our windows were installed was unbelievable - the crew OF EIGHT guys showed up just after 8am and were done with our entire house (17 windows, including 2 sliders and a brand new front door - YES, they do doors too!) before 3pm.  The crew introduced themselves when we crossed paths, they did a clean and precise job of installing each window/door.  They seem to genuinely enjoy their jobs and working with each other (lots of laughing) - for a homeowner that translated into their best work.  AVW installed when they said they would and it took just one day just like they promised.

Javier led the huge crew and walked/talked us through the process.  The rest of the guys; Omar M., Martine, Aaron, Jose S., Raul, Joey and Beto got right to work.  Within the first hour they had all the old windows removed!  Before 3pm our house was transformed!   We didn't put up our curtains for a few days because we enjoyed looking through our new windows too much.  ;)

We selected American Vision Windows because of their reputation and we like to support local businesses. Check out their website and watch the video from the owners - they share why they built their business.  It's a compelling message when you need/want to improve your home and you know it's going to be a large expense - you understand the owners relate to all the concerns a homeowner has when making a choice in contractors.

The only downside to AVW is that we can't hire them to do everything else we want to do around our house!  Haha!

I would recommend them to anyone, any time.  They will take care of you and take great care of your home.</Text>

<Name>Dave Kaupp<//Name>< text>
Let me start off by saying the product, the windows themselves, are great. This order was the second set of windows that we have purchased. The installation was generally OK. The crew did a good and timely job. They made a mistake by removing and throwing away some doggies doors that were suppose to remain. They also broke a window treatment and did a poor job sealing several large cracks in the stucco around an installed slider. I called the customer service line and immediately got a response to my complaints. Several reps came to the house and inspected the damage. The cracked stucco was fixed by the end of the week. I was told that the company would order replacement dog doors and they would be sent immediately. That was over 3  months ago. Easily 20 unanswered phone calls have been made. When I did connect, they promised me the doors would be delivered by the end of the week each time with no result. I have a promise from the customer service supervisor that he has physically touched the doors, of course they just arrived today, and they will be here in two days. We'll see. They never have acknowledged the broken window treatment. I figure I'm just going to have to eat that one. Use at your own risk. I never will again. Home Depot here I come!< /text>

< Review>
It has now been a few years since we had our windows installed. The men who installed the windows did an absolute perfect job. One of our windows came in wrong and they ordered and reinstalled the correct window. What bothered me was the salesmen who sold us the windows acted like it was our fault but it was his. We went with this company because he said the owners did not want anyone to be unhappy and always made sure the customer was happy. We are still happy with the windows. We at the time ordered a new front door, we ordered the one we wanted that had a beautiful carved glass insert in the middle of the door. We waited a long time and they brought the door, but it was not what we ordered. They took the door back then called and I would say we were bullied into taking that door, to appease us they put a film on the back of the glass and came and installed it . It was not at all what we originally ordered and it was thin hollow and cheap. When they brought it over we had the hardware for it and they had only made one hole for the lock when I said I needed another hole for the deadbolt they said they couldn't and wouldn't take the time to do it. I could not fight with them at any point I have a heart condition and didn't want to be upset. This company bullies you into accepting what ever mistakes they make and then makes you feel so bad that it takes a long time for you to give a review.  I have thought about how unhappy I was for a long time. I hope if you purchase from this company you have a better experience then I had.</Review>

<Rating>5< /Rating><review>This is my review of my experience with American Vision Windows (AVW) We had an issue with some defectively installed windows in the newer home we purchased. We had some windows that left a 1/4â€ gap when they were â€œclosedâ€ and we could always hear the street noise and feel the wind come through that gap. Some wouldnâ€™t lock...so for both security and climate control, we reported these issues to our home warranty. I mention this because, things donâ€™t always move along quickly when going through a warranty but AVW was patient with us through the whole process. ARMEN came out to explain why their ANLIN brand windows were better than some of the others out there on the market. I liked the idea that I can easily tilt my new windows in for cleaning or... in case of a needed escape they tilt and come out. Again, all of my interactions were kind and helpful, especially when I needed help with paperwork that I needed to send into the warranty company.

We had LOGAN and NACHO as our two installers and I cant say enough about how Professional, Courteous and Clean they were. Together we walked through the house showing which windows were being replaced. Then, they laid down thick this cardboard material that came on a roll. They cut to fit and placed this on the floor under where they would be working and laid tarps on nearby furniture. They were both careful and considerate with their work. Both told me that they love their work....and it showed in their attitudes and their work value. And there was very little cleanup inside the home once the new windows were put in place. Super pleased with that!

Once the windows were installed, sealed and hand cleaned they went through all of the features of my new windows. Like the tilt in feature earlier mentioned and the safety locks are awesome because I can now open my windows about 2 inches until they meet the pop-out safety lock, and I can keep a breeze coming through and still feel secure. I have to say that of all of the things I love about my new windows.. they are so quiet! No more street noise! And thereâ€™s not a hint of air coming through from the outside when they shut. The windows themselves have enough weather stripping but LOGAN and NACHO put so much sealant when putting each one in place that thereâ€™s no way Iâ€™m going to have any problems with my new windows leaking any air. And no more annoying air drafts. Iâ€™m very happy with American Vision Windows and recommend them. I also recommend the ANLIN windows that we purchased through them. Go with American Vision Windows and go with ANLIN window brand.< /review>< Pictures>

As I was going through home renovations, I knew that replacing all the windows in my home was going to be a very large expense towards the home. I went into this patient and diligent, and in fact met 7 other window companies before running into Don at American vision. What actually turned me to american vision was my strong interest in Anlin brand windows. I did tons of homework and read a bunch of Reddit's on reviews of Anlin brand as well as other windows as well such as Milgard, Simonton etc...Once I was officially set with Anlin the next step was finding a credible company to install the windows. A good quality window is only as good as how it was installed and based on my research this was going to be the selling point to whichever company I was going to do the business with. So naturally first thing I checked was Anlin website direct to get a sense of what company does most of their installs. This is essentially how I found American vision windows which from my understanding does the most volume when it comes to Anlin. I submitted the request online and Don was pretty much over the house taking measurements days later. From the get go I was impressed with American vision initially starting with Don. He knew his product but not only did he know his product I can tell he believed in the product. Through my experience I've found when you see a sales rep lack confidence in the product they are trying to "sell" you. This was different Don knew his product and I felt strongly he believed in it and instead he was "helping" not "selling". He was also a straight shooter, was up front about everything, there were no surprises of any sort and it was just overall a nice and smooth business transaction from the get go. Another thank you to Don as well was getting Christian to come out and do the final measurements before the windows went into production. Christian... I was truly blown away from his knowledge and how he goes about making sure we're on the same page. We went over every window, the specs, the model, the whole nine, he suggested how the windows should open for proper functionality, since I got casements so swing left and right was what I wanted so he made sure it all made sense and updated the work order. After Christian took the measurements I truly felt so much more confident in American vision cause you can really tell their was a process to their quality. Final Measuring is probably the most important step of the process and it was really a cool experience to go through that with Christian. Last but not least I have to give a huge shoutout for the entire crew who came out to do the actual install. 3 team's of technicians totaling 8-9 or so and just watching these guys do the work was pretty amazing. Everybody knew their role, how to do their role, and the entire job was completed in one day. I normally don't leave this lengthy of a review but as I was writing it, it all came out so freely because of my actual experience. From me and my family we would like to personally thank Don, Christian, Javier, Sergio, Omar, Aron, Joshua, Emilio and Daniel for truly making our home beautiful and energy efficient with brand new Anlin windows. This is the second time I have used American Vision Windows to replace trapezoid windows up high in my house.  The first time everything was perfect.  From the sales person, measuring person and installation.  However the second time around the person that measured the windows measured one upside down.  So the window came in and the installation guys replaced three of the four and said the last one needed to be reordered.  Mistakes happen so this was not a big deal.  I ordered the windows in October 2016.  The three windows were replaced in November just after Thanksgiving.  For some reason the last window did not come in until the second week of January 2017.  I had called Oscar four times (went to voicemail), left messages twice and left two emails.  No return call and no reply email.  I finally called the toll free number and asked to speak to someone and the transfer me to Oscar.  He tells me he is no longer in charge of my account and that it is someone else who he transfers my call to me.  Daniel got on the computer and told me when the window was expected to come in and he was on the mark.  Not sure why I got the runaround but it did get frustrating as I was hoping to have the windows completed way before Christmas so I did not have to move furniture around as much.  I had to move the furniture for the measurements and then for the install and then back for guests and then move them again for the install of the last window.  I realize the measurement was an honest mistake but the lack of communication could have been prevented.  After the great service the first time I was left a little disappointed the second time around.  Especially from a company that was built around customer satisfaction.</Text>

< Text>
I wanted to make sure you received some feedback on my experience from first setting up the sales appointment through Donna Rennick, working with Gina Perin for the sale, and then dealing with the team that was sent out to install windows throughout my house.  It was all just the most easy and low stress process.

The guys that showed up to do the install were David Daniel, Justin Trent, Jake Mohon and Jose Guzman.  My initial impressions were great.  They showed up on time, they were clean and got to work right away.  My subsequent impressions were even better.  There is a certain expectation whenever you contract with a company to do a big install like this.  At the very least, the product should be what was advertised and the employees installing should know what they are doing.  My expectations were certainly blown away.

Throughout the day I would walk around just to see the progress.  I never found anyone not working.  And working fast!  In addition to their work, they were some of the nicest and most professional people I have ever had come into my house to do work.  I was so pleased with everything that happened yesterday.

Please extend my thanks to the team and make sure you let the manager of these gentlemen know what wonderful representatives of your company they are.  I knew of American Vision Windows years before I called you.  It is obvious that it is through employees like these that you have grown such a great reputation.<//Text>

< time>
1359476458414<//time>
<rating>5</rating>< Review>
My wife had spine surgery, and we had an old track sliding door that was always hard to open. This door became even more difficult for her to open,  and I had to keep spraying WD-40 on the track wheels. I am  an ex-contractor with a bad back and  we decided it was time to start shopping around for some quotes on new sliding glass doors. Knowing the old saying you get what you pay for better than most in this field, I wanted to do some research on reputable companies that had been around for a while and would stand behind their warranty's. I checked all the review sites including Yelp, called several companies to come out and give us a quote.  Most of them were guys that must have sold used cars for a living and just gave you the feeling that they would say anything you wanted to hear to make the sale. Our last quote was from American Vision Windows the salesmen was on time, professional and most important was not pushy showed me things about windows I never knew and it was very clear that all the doors we looked at were well made as well as the Anlin doors. The prices were about the same as the other guys it was a no brainer. The salesmen said it would be about 3 weeks out before the door would be ready and he was right on they called to set up the installation time, the guys showed up when they said they would, were very polite, careful and clean. I was amazed it only took them a little over an hour to take out the old one and put in the new one. We were very pleased with the result's. We love our new slider the low-E glass filed with argon gas really makes a huge difference. We no longer have to close the blinds in the afternoon and the kitchen is noticeably cooler in the summer.<//Review>

<gmapID>0x80e82eecc76a1a6f:0x14861a5b0346ded0</gmapID><userid>105292087441474004964</userid>< Text>
Awesome to Awful

What a dreadful experience. After many years of great service American Vision Windows Simi has gone way downhill. The last round took seven months and 10 service calls to remedy multiple problems. Project manager Mike Wilson, with whom we have had many years of great service, stopped returning calls, even when I was trying to order more windows from him. I ended up having to hound his assistant Erica Balladarez just to order windows. She was helpful until the problems started and then she stopped returning multiple calls and emails to address the issues. Ian from finance had no problem calling though to collect the final payment, even though the project was still far from complete.

Problems:
1. Windows had been manufactured so that the moving sash was far too small. Meaning it would wobble in the frame and pop out of the frame when opened. This should have been caught before installation. This resulted in 9, in home service calls in order to be resolved. All of which I had to be at home to attend to.
2. I ordered another set of windows to match all the others AVW had installed. Emailing Erica to ensure they were correctly configured to match all of our other windows. Sure enough, no one checked them before shipping them to us and they arrived with vertical grids instead of horizontal grids. I have the email I sent to Erica to ensure they would be horizontal.  Another service call here to get that fixed.
3. Complete lack of project management. One department doesn't communicate with another. Finance had no idea that the project had not been completed. Service had no idea that the project hadn't been completed. Many openly admitted that there was no oversight or management of the projects and folks who weren't tasked with managing had to step in to push the project forward.

What worked well:
1. Chris Walker in service was amazing. He called out the problems early on and pushed to get them fixed. No one listened to him though which is why the project spiraled into 9 service calls. In the end, he was the one who came out and fixed most of the problems.

Overall, I have gone from a happy and solid customer, recommending them to many others resulting in additional sales to one who strongly recommends that they be avoided. What a shame. Such a great relationship crushed by so much carelessness.<//Text>

<Review>I had 19 windows installed on 7-7-2012. The windows are GREAT!
I had louver windows in kitchen and living room, if you know what those are, they were installed back in the 60's. I loved everything about those  louver  windows except the cold of winter poured through them and anyone could jimmy them open.
I had gotten a quote from an Arizona company, boy, what a run around they gave me and they not organized at all!!
Don from American Vision Windows came out one day for the quote and sold me on some great windows. I did not want the white windows, I wanted the beige color and they could order them for me. My neighbor just had new windows installed last year, her window's are not the quality or  was there the attention to details of instillation  that mine were and she paid quite a bit more.
The installers from AVW were professional, personable, efficient, friendly,  on time and hard working. There were a couple pieces of furniture that I could not move myself and they took care of it for me. <rating>5<//rating>< text>
I called American Vision Windows to ask for a bid to replace 8 very old windows. I already had a very long sales pitch from Sears and a not-so-great contractor from Costco come out. When I called AVW I was a bit skeptical when I spoke with the associate because he quickly suggested that I come into the showroom to see the difference between the windows Costco quoted me and what AVW could offer me at a similar price for a higher quality window.

I went to the showroom and was very impressed by the large selection of windows and the personalized attention. I met with Brad and he provided me with a clear and concise explanation of the windows from Costco and then showed me the windows he recommended for me.

I decided to go with AVW because I really appreciated their excellent customer service. After I purchased the windows someone came out to get the exact measurements to make the windows. About 5 weeks later my new windows were ready for installation. Two very professional installers came out and by the end of the day my new windows were in place! I couldn't believe how neat and clean everything looked after installation. I didn't need to paint or even vacuum!

I am SO happy that I listened to Brad and went with the windows he suggested. I am writing this review from triple digits in Calabasas and my AC running at 82 degrees. The triple paned gas filled windows are keeping my home so cool I am already seeing savings in my electricity bill.

I highly recommend AVW!</text>
